title: I heard that newspapers publish articles in different length in the print, online, and mobile version. Is that true? - Quora

response.answer_text: Of course. Print is very much controlled by advertising revenue. If you consistently print more pages than advertising will support, you’ll go bankrupt. It’s different for digital and mobile. But articles online also tend to be shorter because the public’s attention span is now much much smaller than it was 20 years ago. Readers tend not to read long articles online. Too much distraction, too small an attention span, and it’s not a “comfortable” read.
